Description: Pale gold finger-ring of Egyptian type; rounded loop, flattened and spread at the shoulder; oval bezel with rudely engraved design within linear border: crouching human figure(?) with a branch on either side.
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (5)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Richard Cornwallis Neville, 4th Baron Braybrooke
